functionalj.list.doublelist

Interface DoubleFuncListWithSegment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsDoubleFuncList, AsDoubleStreamPlus, AsDoubleStreamPlusWithCalculate, AsDoubleStreamPlusWithCollect, AsDoubleStreamPlusWithConversion, AsDoubleStreamPlusWithForEach, AsDoubleStreamPlusWithGroupingBy, AsDoubleStreamPlusWithReduce, AsDoubleStreamPlusWithStatistic
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DoubleFuncList
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DoubleFuncListDerived, DoubleStep, ImmutableDoubleFuncList, StreamBackedDoubleFuncList

    public interface DoubleFuncListWithSegment
extends AsDoubleFuncList

    • Method Detail

      • segment

        default FuncList<DoubleFuncList> segment(int count)
        Segment the stream into sub stream with the fix length of count. Note: <ul> <li>The last portion may be shorter.</li> <li>If the count is less than or equal to 0, an empty stream is return.</li> </ul>
        Parameters:
        count - the element count of the sub stream.

      • segment

        default FuncList<DoubleFuncList> segment(DoubleToIntFunction segmentSize)
        Create a stream of sub-stream which size is derived from the value. If the segmentSize function return 0, the value will be ignored.

      • segmentWhen

        default FuncList<DoubleFuncList> segmentWhen(DoublePredicate startCondition)
        Segment the stream into sub stream whenever the start condition is true. The tail sub stream will always be included.

      • segmentAfter

        default FuncList<DoubleFuncList> segmentAfter(DoublePredicate endCondition)
        Segment the stream into sub stream starting the element after the precondition is true.

      • segmentBetween

        default FuncList<DoubleFuncList> segmentBetween(DoublePredicate startCondition,
                                                DoublePredicate endCondition)
        Segment the stream into sub stream starting when the start condition is true and ending when the end condition is true -- both inclusively. Note: this method will include the last sub stream even if the end condition is never been true before the stream ended.
        Parameters:
        startCondition - the condition to start the sub stream
        endCondition - the condition to end the sub stream

      • segmentBetween

        default FuncList<DoubleFuncList> segmentBetween(DoublePredicate startCondition,
                                                DoublePredicate endCondition,
                                                boolean includeIncompletedSegment)
        Segment the stream into sub stream starting when the start condition is true and ending when the end condition is true -- both inclusively.
        Parameters:
        startCondition - the condition to start the sub stream
        endCondition - the condition to end the sub stream
        includeIncompletedSegment - specifying if the incomplete segment at the end should be included.

      • segmentBetween

        default FuncList<DoubleFuncList> segmentBetween(DoublePredicate startCondition,
                                                DoublePredicate endCondition,
                                                IncompletedSegment incompletedSegment)
        Segment the stream into sub stream starting when the start condition is true and ending when the end condition is true -- both inclusively.
        Parameters:
        startCondition - the condition to start the sub stream
        endCondition - the condition to end the sub stream
        incompletedSegment - specifying if the incomplete segment at the end should be included.
